summary: The Enhancing First Response Act focuses on improving emergency response capabilities and network reliability. It mandates the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to issue reports after the activation of the Disaster Information Reporting System, including details on outages affecting various communication services. The bill also requires public field hearings. It further directs the Office of Management and Budget to categorize public safety telecommunicators as a protective service occupation. Finally, it mandates a report on the implementation of Kari's Law regarding multi-line telephone systems.
